data.title: Attacking Each Other, Attacking Europe: Negative Advertising in the 2019 European Election
data.sourcetitle: The 2019 European Electoral Campaign: in the Time of Populism and Social Media
data.abstract: This chapter examines the use of negative campaigning and concludes that there is limited support for the view that this was a highly polarized and conflict-saturated election given only 14 per cent of all campaign messages were negative, a lower amount compared with the 2014 campaign. Results also indicate, in line with previous research, that fringe parties (particularly right-wing ones) are most likely to use negative appeals.
